stream ecology: The study of aquatic life forms and their relationships with their surroundings in freshwater and brackish environments, including the investigation of how these organisms adapt to and thrive in various levels of conductivity, from pristine waters to those with elevated mineral content, and how they interact with their environments to influence their own distributions and populations.
